New Records: For the first time in the history of the men's ODI World Cup, Pakistan have lost four consecutive matches.
Key Match Events: Shamsi took 4 wickets for 60 runs for South Africa.
Markram scored 91 runs for South Africa.
Afridi took 3 wickets for 45 runs for Pakistan.
Keshav Maharaj hit the winning runs with 16 balls remaining.
South Africa are now top of the table with 10 points from six games.
Pakistan are sixth with four points from six matches.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was arguably the best so far in this World Cup.
The first heartstopping match of the 2023 World Cup.
